example[1]: Will you stop having a go at me!
example[2]: Mum had a go at me for not doing my homework.
note[1]: have a go at somebody for/about something
example[3]: A whole gang of yobs were standing around, just waiting to have a go.
definition[2]: to try to catch someone who you see doing something wrong, rather than waiting for the police
example[4]: The public should not be encouraged to have a go.
